event: Groundbreaking of Pashk-2 Nuclear Power Plant
description: Rosatom General Director Alexei Likhachev marked the significance of the Pashk-2 nuclear power plant project in Hungary, built according to the latest Russian design. The construction will be closely monitored globally, and the company will fulfill its obligations to the European Commission. Likhachev highlighted the long-standing cooperation between Russian and Hungarian specialists in the nuclear energy sector.
original: “The first concrete is like the first breath of a child after birth - after that the construction site becomes a truly powerful nuclear facility,” this is how Rosatom General Director Alexei Likhachev commented on the importance of the Pashk-2 nuclear power plant project, which is being built in Hungary according to the latest Russian design, for the Russian Federation. According to him, the construction will be under the attention of the entire planet, and the company has obligations in connection with the decisions of the EC, which are always fulfilled. “Despite all the difficulties, this is a great pleasure. Since the 70s of the last century, Soviet specialists, Russians, and Hungarians have been creating a nuclear power plant energy sector, then together we exploited it and developed it. And we will continue the tradition of our fathers,” Likhachev noted. He spoke about the order received for long-term production of equipment. After acceptance, under the supervision of Hungarian specialists, the company will begin manufacturing the heart of the nuclear power plant - the reactor vessel, and then organize the project. Subscribe to IZ.RU

event: Death of Ex-Boeing Engineer John Barnett
description: Ex-Boeing engineer John Barnett, who testified against the company, was found dead in his car in a hotel parking lot. He had claimed that workers installed defective parts on the Boeing 787 Dreamliner to avoid production delays. His death was ruled a suicide by police.
original:
Ex-Boeing engineer John Barnett was found dead after testifying against the company. The man worked for the aircraft concern for 32 years. After retiring in 2017, he began a lengthy legal battle with the corporation. Thus, the ex-engineer claimed that workers, under pressure from management, deliberately installed defective parts on the Boeing 787 Dreamliner in order to avoid production delays.

As the victim's lawyer, Brian Knowles, said, a few days before the tragedy, Barnett testified in the Boeing case. And on Saturday he was supposed to come again to meet with investigators.

Barnett was soon found dead in his own car in a hotel parking lot. According to the police, it was a suicide.

The company did not ignore the tragedy - on March 11, Boeing expressed condolences over the death of a former employee. Read more in our material. Subscribe to REN TV

event: Fire Danger Period Declared on Curonian Spit
description: A fire danger period has been declared on the Curonian Spit. To mitigate risks, a comprehensive plan has been approved, and strict measures are in place to prevent and respond to forest fires. Open fires are only allowed in designated areas, and violators will face fines ranging from 3,000 to 4,000 rubles.
original:
Forwarded from: Klops
A fire danger period has been declared on the Curonian Spit. “A comprehensive plan of measures to prepare for the fire danger period of 2024, a scheme for alerting and collecting personnel when detecting and extinguishing forest and other natural fires in the national park have been approved,” the statement says.

It is strictly forbidden to make fires on the Curonian Spit; you can only use an open fire in a barbecue in specially designated places: on the territory of tourist centers and guest houses. If open fire is detected in other places, state inspectors will draw up a report on an administrative violation. The fine ranges from 3 to 4 thousand rubles. Monitoring is carried out around the clock, including using video surveillance and space monitoring.

description: The Ministry of Education of the Stavropol Territory refuted false claims that Orthodox crosses on the Kazan Cathedral in Stavropol were covered up in a video for the lessons 'Conversations about Important Things'. The original video, available on the project's website, clearly shows the crosses and other Orthodox symbols.
original:
The Ministry of Education of the Stavropol Territory denied the fake news that in the video for the lessons “Conversations about Important Things,” Orthodox crosses on the Kazan Cathedral in Stavropol were allegedly covered up. False information was circulated the day before by some telegram channels. In the video, students sing a song about Russia in different languages of the peoples of our country. However, some “bloggers”, having downloaded this video from additional materials to “Conversations about Important Things”, published there as a regional component (the lesson is dedicated to the country and each region separately), posted it with some changes. Ill-wishers decided to distort the essence of the project, writing that there were no crosses on Orthodox churches in the video, the department reported.

In fact, in the original video, which can be freely downloaded on the project’s website, the crosses of the Kazan Cathedral can be seen literally in the first seconds of the video. Orthodox symbols are also clearly visible in other frames of the video material.

The Ministry of Education of the region drew the attention of teachers to the need to use lesson materials “Talking about important things” only from the official website of the project in order to avoid such fakes and not fall for a provocation.

event: Study on Nanoplastics and Health Risks
description: A study by Italian scientists found nanoplastic particles in the arteries of 58% of patients undergoing carotid artery surgery, increasing the risk of heart attack, stroke, and death by 4.5 times. The research highlights the potential health risks of nanoplastics, which have been found in breast milk, placenta, and blood plasma.
original:
“The study revealed the first signs that nanoplastics are harmful to people’s health”: The main scourge of the 21st century - nanoplastics accumulating in the human body - was found in the arteries of patients in cardiac departments. Nanoplastics increase the risk of heart attack, stroke and death by almost five times.

“It is already known that nanoplastic can be found even in breast milk and placenta, blood plasma, or even accumulate inside the body’s cells. And although a number of experiments involving animals have shown that these particles can affect health, their effect on humans has not yet been properly studied.
A team of Italian scientists led by Raffaele Marfella decided to correct this by analyzing data from 257 patients who went to three hospitals in the country to remove atherosclerotic plaques in the carotid artery. Tests revealed nanoplastic particles in 58% of the patients mentioned.
Scientists concluded that the risk of death and heart attack in such patients is 4.5 times greater. “This is a compelling result that opens up new insights into the pollutants we are exposed to but cannot see,” said study participant Jaime Marrugat. Inflammatory markers, which show the body's response to what it perceives as a threat and which increase the risk of heart disease, were higher in people with nanoplastic particles in the carotid artery."

event: Mass Searches of Artists and Activists
description: Russian security forces, identifying themselves as FSB officers, conducted mass searches of at least 12 artists and activists across the country, confiscating equipment and taking several individuals in for interrogation. The searches are believed to be connected to a new treason case against Pyotr Verzilov, founder of Pussy Riot.
original:
Mass searches of artists and activists in Russia. The main thing for this minute ✹ Today, security forces searched at least 12 Russian artists, among them: Katrin Nenasheva and Natalya Chetverio, Sasha Blot, Kristina Bubentsova, art group “Yav” (St. Petersburg), Rita Flores, Olga Kuracheva and Olga Pakhtusova (members of Pussy Riot, Moscow), Egor Kholtov (Ulyanovsk), Artem Filatov and Andrey Olenev (Nizhny Novgorod), Ilya Mozgi (Ekaterinburg), Denis Mustafin (Samara).

✹ Also searched were the mother of Pussy Riot founder and former Mediazona publisher Pyotr Verzilov and a friend of the Moscow artist Philippenzo. The security forces introduce themselves as FSB officers.

✹ The Network Freedoms project connected the searches with a new criminal case against Pyotr Verzilov. According to human rights activists, he is accused of treason. This case was not previously known. Verzilov left Russia in 2020.

✹ During the searches, security forces confiscated the artists’ equipment. In Samara, gadgets were confiscated from the apartment of actionist Denis Mustafin when he himself was not at home. The artist’s mother was at her place of registration.

✹ After the searches, at least six artists were taken away for interrogation: Kristina Bubentsova, Katrin Nenasheva, Olga Kuracheva, Olga Pakhtusova, Ilya Mozgi and Yegor Kholtov. Many have already been released from the department.

✹ Student Elizaveta from Perm also reported the search to OVD-Info. The girl's equipment was confiscated and she was interrogated as a witness.

✹ The artist and former director of the branch of the Pushkin Museum, Kristina Gorlanova, who was also searched, said that she was a witness in the criminal case of an “artist” whose name she was forbidden to disclose. According to Gorlanova, she does not know this person.

———

In the photo, artist Katrin Nenasheva is taken away for interrogation after a search. Screenshot from the Sota video telegram channel.

description: Rosatom State Corporation has initiated mass production of 3D printers for various Russian industries. The first serial product, RusMelt 310M, uses selective laser melting technology to produce metal powder composition products. This development aids import substitution, enabling the production of parts and introduction of technologies in heavy engineering, automotive, aerospace, and nuclear industries.
original: The Rosatom State Corporation has begun mass production of 3D printers for a number of Russian industries, the press service of the fuel division of the TVEL company reported. Nine devices of the “mid-size” class will be produced. “According to industry experts, this volume corresponds to more than 30% of the Russian industry’s need for additive equipment in 2024,” the report says. At the same time, the first serial product was the RusMelt 310M machine, which operates on technologies of selective laser melting. It allows you to produce products from metal powder compositions. The appearance of such a product allowed the state corporation to promote it in the domestic and foreign markets. “The printer allows us to solve problems in the field of import substitution, since new equipment is used for the production of parts and the introduction of technologies in heavy engineering, automotive, aerospace and nuclear industries,” added the general director of the integrator company "Rosatom" in the field of additive technologies by Ilya Kavelashvili.Subscribe to IZ.RU

original:
Forwarded from: FrequentFlyers
The last Boeing 757 in Russia is being prepared for flights. The only Boeing 757 in storage in a condition of airworthiness may soon return to the skies. This is a 26-year-old B757-200 from the discontinued Royal Flight airline. It has been in storage at Sheremetyevo Airport for two years, since March 8, 2022. The aircraft is dual registered VQ-BTR and RA-73357 and is owned by Irish leasing company AerCap.

Negotiations are currently underway on an insurance settlement for this aircraft, after which it will be debermuded and will join the fleet of AZUR air, the only operator of Boeing 757 passenger aircraft in Russia. The airline has ten Boeing 757-200 (one in the Full Business configuration), of which eight actively fly to international destinations: from Moscow to Egypt and the Maldives, from the regions to Thailand.

The aircraft, manufactured in 1998, has a one-class layout with 235 seats and is perfect for transporting package tourists.

Earlier, at the end of December 2023, AerCap had already resolved disputes regarding 18 Ural Airlines aircraft and 29 S7 aircraft. In addition, AerCap owns several aircraft from Nordwind, Smartavia, Rossiya, Yakutia and Yamal, for which no settlement has yet been reached.

As for Royal Flight, the Boeing 737-800 RA-73358 remaining in Russia was transferred to Pobeda; it will fly on a summer schedule; all other carrier vehicles remained abroad. AZUR air also has one Boeing 737-800 without LG in storage (RA-73475), but it has not yet been possible to reach an agreement on it with another foreign lessor. The situation is similar with the Boeing 777-300ER RA-73469. It was, of course, possible to “raise” and operate these two aircraft on domestic flights, but such a business model for AZUR air did not justify itself (the airline tried to operate on domestic flights in 2021-2022), and even maintain a “zoo” of one aircraft at a time different types are ineffective from an economic point of view, while the B757 and B767, which AZUR flies, are structurally similar and crews can fly two types with one type rating. https://www.frequentflyers.ru/2024/ 03/12/73357/@frequentflyers

event: Meeting of BRICS Ministers of Justice
description: The first meeting of the BRICS Ministers of Justice took place within the St. Petersburg International Legal Forum. The Russian Ministry of Justice proposed creating a permanent body for industry cooperation, the BRICS Council of Ministers of Justice, to strengthen cooperation in the field of justice based on equality and mutual respect.
original:
This year, within the framework of the St. Petersburg International Legal Forum, the first meeting of the BRICS Ministers of Justice will take place. “The cooperation of the BRICS Justice Ministries deserves its own special platform. That is why we want to take the initiative to create a permanent body for industry cooperation - the BRICS Council of Ministers of Justice,” said the head of the Russian Ministry of Justice, Konstantin Chuychenkona, at a meeting with the ambassadors of the countries of the association. According to him, the Council’s task could be to strengthen cooperation in the field of justice based on the principles of equality and mutual respect.

In addition, the parties discussed the following issues: 🔹strengthening connections between the BRICS countries by forming common legal principles that can form the basis of economic, humanitarian and cultural integration of states; 🔹mechanisms for improving investment arbitration; 🔹options for creating new platforms for systemic and multilateral discussion of issues justice within the BRICS, etc.

The operator of the events of Russia's chairmanship of the BRICS association and the organizer of the SPBILF is the Roscongress Foundation. More information in the package.

Photo: website of the Ministry of Justice of the Russian Federation@roscongress

description: The Perm research and production enterprise TIK has successfully replaced American products, ensuring technological sovereignty in the oil, gas, and chemical industries. With state support, the enterprise is developing and increasing momentum, planning to double production volumes in the coming years.
original:
Forwarded from: Dmitry Makhonin
The Perm research and production enterprise TIK is a clear example of how the departure of foreign “partners” from our markets opens up new opportunities for development.

TIK has been producing vibration sensors for more than 30 years; they help monitor the condition of expensive equipment in the oil, gas, and chemical industries. In recent years, the number of large customers has grown significantly - Transneft, LUKOIL, Rosneft, Sibur, Perm products are used in Arctic projects. The enterprise managed to successfully replace American products and ensure the technological sovereignty of an entire area. The enterprise is developing and increasing momentum, including thanks to state support, the presidential national project “Labor Productivity” and participation in the regional industrial cooperation program. I visited a new site where its own research institute and main production are located. The demand for the developments of Perm industrialists is only growing, so in the coming years TIK plans to double production volumes. To do this, they are mastering another building.

We discussed the personnel issue with the management of the enterprise. TIK invites students to practice; the salaries here are decent, but there is still a demand for specialists. One option is to cooperate more actively with our technical schools and colleges in municipalities and enter into agreements on targeted training. We will definitely continue to support you in all plans.

event: Russian Aerospace Forces Use Glide Bombs
description: Russia has increased production of powerful glide bombs, such as the FAB-1500, to destroy Ukrainian defenses. The use of these bombs has increased the depth of strikes on Ukrainian positions, causing significant damage and putting pressure on soldiers' morale.
original:
BI: Glide bombs have increased the depth of strikes by the Russian Aerospace Forces on the positions of the Ukrainian Armed Forces. Russia is increasing the production of powerful glide bombs, which it uses to destroy Ukrainian defenses, Business Insider reports.

According to a Ukrainian serviceman who is in Krasnogorovka, previously his unit’s positions were fired only from artillery, but now the Russian Armed Forces have begun to actively use the FAB-1500.

"Why do they use the FAB-1500? Because the damage it causes is very serious. If you survive, you are guaranteed to have a shell shock," the Ukrainian military said in an interview with CNN. This puts a lot of pressure on soldiers' morale, he said. “If they are already more or less accustomed to the FAB-500, then the FAB-1500 is hell,” he noted.

Analysts at the American Institute for the Study of War (ISW) indicate that the use of bombs with planning and correction modules “increases the depth of strikes” that Russia can inflict on Ukrainian positions.

Merco Press:Miley threatened to give urine therapy to recalcitrant Argentine governors and shut down CongressArgentine President Javier Miley, during a private event at the ExpoAgro rural fair in San Nicolas de los Arroyos last week, said he would “urinate” on all the provincial governors of Argentina, who are reluctant to approve the reforms proposed by his government. “If they continue, I will close the Congress,” he added. Since Miley called for the May 25 Pact to resolve the ongoing crisis, many provincial governors have threatened not to accept invitation from the president. For example, Santa Fe Governor Maximiliano Pullaro said his province “will not be extorted” or intimidated. Martin Liariora from Cordoba criticized the extended deadline until May 25.

It was also reported that Miley's outburst occurred during his speech behind closed doors to businessmen whom he called “heroes”. Presidential Secretary Karina Miley and Interior Minister Guillermo Francos were present at the event, Página 12 reports. A meeting with the governors is planned for Friday. description: In 2023, 1.12 billion personal data records were leaked online, a 60% increase from 2022. This was due to 95 large database leaks from Russian companies, with an average of 1.7 million records leaked per incident.
original:
According to RBC, 1.12 billion personal data were leaked online in 2023, which is almost 60% higher than in 2022, according to an InfoWatch study. In total, 95 large databases were leaked from Russian companies. “If we talk about the number of incidents, then in 2023 it decreased by 15% and amounted to 656 episodes. However, this slight decrease was more than offset by the growing damage that organizations receive from effective leaks,” commented Andrey Arsentyev, head of analytics and special projects at the InfoWatch Group of Companies’ expert analytical center.

According to him, the average amount of personal data leaked per incident almost doubled in 2023, from 0.9 million to 1.7 million records.

InfoWatch noted an increase in the share of leaks of state secrets in 2023 by 3.6 times, from 1.8 to 6.6%; of which 73.6% of the information related to personal data.@Russian_OSINT

event: End of Zero VAT Rate on Food
description: The Polish Ministry of Finance has decided not to extend the zero VAT rate on basic food products after March 31, citing declining inflation rates. The zero VAT rate was introduced in February 2022 as part of the 'anti-inflation shield' and applied to various food products.
original:
🍞💰🇵🇱The Ministry of Finance of Poland has decided not to extend the zero VAT rate on basic food products after March 31.

Considering the increase in electricity prices, the Poles are in for a tough time.🔻The zero VAT rate on food has been in effect in Poland since February 2022. It was introduced within the framework of the so-called “anti-inflation shield”.

The department indicated that since inflation is declining, it is not advisable to extend the benefits, especially since, according to the forecast of the Ministry of Finance, the low level of inflation will continue in the coming months. The benefit was introduced with annual CPI growth of 9.2%, and in January this year, inflation fell to 3.9% year-on-year and was the lowest since March 2021.

The zero VAT rate applied to vegetables, fruits, meat and meat products, milk and dairy products, as well as grain products.

At the same time, the Polish government claims that it will be possible to return to this measure at any time.#Poland#economy@pl_syrenka—Poland is not abroadRMF24Zerowy VAT na żywność. description: The forces and means involved in the attack on the border regions suggest the intent was to create a 'small racket' rather than gain a foothold. The operation involved DRGs simulating enemy penetration, UAV attacks, and information dumps to create panic. However, the outcome, even in the case of hypothetical success, is unclear.
original:
Forwarded from: Hard Blog
The forces and means involved in the attack on the border regions clearly reveal the intent of the operation. This is not enough to gain a foothold and, having started a battle, wait for reinforcements. This is not enough for anything other than organizing a “small racket.”

That is, the idea was this: DRGs simulate the penetration of enemy forces into the territory of the region, UAV attacks create a background noise, information dumps create panic. But in the end - what? What is the result even in case of hypothetical success? It’s difficult for me to judge, because on the other side, all this is planned and carried out by people who are completely divorced from reality. What's in their head is a mystery.

But only a person with complete atrophy of responsibility, an adventurer with crazy plans, can throw people into a senseless adventure like this, with some mythical goals. There are naive startupers who pour money into a project that is “definitely going to work.” But they are wasting money in a hopeless enterprise, and here are human lives.

What would happen if successful? Pointless losses. What is the result of failure? Pointless losses. Some kind of fierce cannibalism and complete projection. What did you hope to convert the media effect into? In money from the West? Maybe you'll just sell these soldiers to us? Why intermediaries? Set a price, maybe we can ransom these hostages.

So I think it is unreasonable to deprive them of the right to vote; it will not achieve anything, but will only inflame emotions again. This is wrong,” Toots said.

description: Suhrob Zafar, the leader of the banned opposition movement Group 24, has gone missing in Istanbul, Turkey. His phone is switched off, and his whereabouts are unknown. Zafar had received threats of murder or kidnapping with the aim of delivering him to Tajikistan.
original:
Forwarded from: Kompromat Central Asia
Group 24, banned in Tajikistan, reported the disappearance of its leader Suhrob Zafar in Turkey. Activists of the opposition movement Group 24, banned in Tajikistan, reported the disappearance of the organization’s leader, Suhrob Zafar. According to them, Zafar was in Turkey, and for the last two days they have not known anything about his whereabouts.

“Suhrob Zafar went missing in Istanbul (Türkiye). He has not been in touch since the morning of March 10 this year, his phone is also switched off. So far there is no news from Sukhrob, and his whereabouts are unknown. In recent years, the leader of the Group 24 political movement in Turkey has received threats. They threatened him with murder or kidnapping with the aim of delivering him to Tajikistan!” - the organization said in a statement.

“Group 24” was recognized as extremist by the Supreme Court of Tajikistan in the fall of 2014 and banned in the country. That same year, Suhrob Zafar moved from Tajikistan to Turkey and has lived there ever since. Dushanbe has repeatedly tried to achieve the extradition of Sukhrob Zafar; he was detained several times at the request of the Tajik authorities, but was released each time.

In his homeland, Suhrob Zafar is accused of calling for the violent overthrow of the constitutional order.

event: Detention of Car with Russian License Plates
description: Lithuanian customs detained an Audi Q7 with Russian license plates driven by a Moldovan citizen, who was attempting to travel to Belarus. The car's owner was a Russian citizen, and the vehicle was confiscated due to new restrictions introduced by Lithuania on March 11.
original:
The first car with Russian license plates was detained in Lithuania. On the evening of March 11, the driver of an Audi Q7, a citizen of Moldova, planned to travel to Belarus with Russian license plates, but was detained at Lithuanian customs. When checking the documents, it turned out that the owner of the Audi is another person - a citizen of Russia, the country's customs department reports.

The driver's car worth 41,690 euros was confiscated. The man insisted that he knew nothing about the new restrictions.

From March 11, Lithuania introduced administrative liability for persons who have cars registered in the Russian Federation, which provides for a fine and possible confiscation of the car. An exception is made for Russian citizens transiting to or from the Kaliningrad region of Russia using a simplified transit document (STD).

description: Russia is introducing a new migration policy, requiring foreign workers to undergo training in special centers and pass biometric checks before entering the country. The policy aims to address personnel shortages and ensure that migrants are familiar with Russian language and values.
original:
Forwarded from: Daily Storm
Migrants will be able to come to Russia only after training in special centers and passing biometrics. The entry of workers from other countries will be carried out strictly according to quotas and applications from employers, said the head of the All-Russian Center for National Construction Policy, Alexander Moor. According to him, “it will be impossible to change the letter in your passport and go back if you were deported.”

He considers attracting migrants to work a necessary measure in the context of a shortage of personnel. For foreign workers arriving in the Russian Federation, centers for teaching the Russian language and Russian values are opened in their homeland. In the future, according to the expert, migrants will not be able to come to Russia if they know nothing about it. And if they try to find a job where they were not invited, such people will be expelled, Moore added. @stormdaily

Novotroitskoe stopped a VAZ-21061 car driven by a 50-year-old resident of the village of Novopokrovka, Novotroitsk district, who, when checking documents, presented a Ukrainian-style driver's license with signs of forgery. As the driver explained, the document was issued to him by the MREO of the city of Odessa after graduating from a driving school.

The driver's license was confiscated and sent for examination to the Forensic Expertise Center of the Main Directorate of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia for the Kherson region.

An investigation into this fact is currently underway.

The State Traffic Inspectorate reminds that the use of a fake vehicle registration certificate, as well as its forgery, is subject to liability under Art. 327 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation. The maximum penalty is imprisonment for up to one year.

description: Hieromartyr Proterius, Patriarch of Alexandria, was martyred on Holy Saturday in the 5th century. Heretics broke into the baptismal sanctuary, killing him and six others. They then dragged his body, tormented him, burned him, and scattered his ashes. The rebellion was eventually suppressed, and those responsible were punished.
original:
On March 12, the Church commemorates the Hieromartyr Proterius, Patriarch of Alexandria. He lived in the 5th century in Alexandria in Egypt and served as a presbyter, fearlessly denouncing heretics and professing the Orthodox faith. In 457, the heretics rebelled and Saint Proterius left the city. But at night the prophet Isaiah appeared to him in a dream, whose words the saint regarded as a warning about his impending martyrdom.

On Holy Saturday (Easter Eve), heretics broke into the baptismal sanctuary and killed the patriarch and six of those with him. Having tied a rope to the saint’s body, they dragged him out into the street and tormented him, then burned him and scattered his ashes to the wind. When they found out about this in the capital, an army was sent to Alexandria, the rebellion was suppressed, and all participants in the murder of the saint were punished. #orthodox_calendar Be with us - First Cossack

description: The Russian reconnaissance-strike complex has improved its capabilities, allowing for swift detection and destruction of the M142 HIMARS. The complex's new combination of SuperCam UAV and unknown missile systems with air-blasted projectiles enables rapid strikes, neutralizing the HIMARS' advantage of quick relocation.
original:
#SVO@mpre_view1
The strikes on the M142 HIMARS are interesting not so much for the defeats of the American MLRS themselves, but for the emerging comprehensive approach to their destruction within the framework of the reconnaissance-strike complex.
Show more
Over almost two years of participation in hostilities, the M142 HIMARS acquired a reputation as an elusive MLRS, since this American installation has a number of advantages, one of which is batch reloading, which is shown in the photograph - the MLRS does not need its own transport-loading vehicle, it reloads itself and immediately package, which greatly speeds up the time to deliver either the next strike or move to cover for further actions. The Ukrainian military has repeatedly noted in their reports that while the GMLRS guided missiles are just flying to the target, the M142 launcher is already leaving the position.
In the summer and autumn of 2022, such a highly mobile missile launcher became a real blow to the guts of the ossified control and coordination system of the Russian army, where so much time can pass between detecting a target and coordinating a strike on it that the target is already gone, we have written about this many times and precisely this Achilles heel of the Russian Armed Forces gave HIMARS an unprecedented advantage.
However, as you can see from two videos at once, the reconnaissance-strike complex of the Russian army seems to have noticeably transformed for the better: in both videos with the defeat of the installation, the time between the detection of the “khimar” and the missile strike is so short that it makes it possible to hit the target at the position which was not the case before. It doesn't even get dark.
What kind of new combination between the SuperCam UAV and the still unknown missile systems with air-blasted projectiles is still unknown, but it works.

This decree applies for the period from 02/24/2022.

 1. The most important thing is the recognition of the guys as participants in the SVO

Now families will have the right to these payments,” comments KSVO legal adviser Evgeniy Masharov. “We have spoken about the problem of recognition of civilian personnel at the Committee’s site and at other institutional events more than once, including with reference to the example with the crew of the above-mentioned vessel.
I consider it extremely important to quickly take measures to make payments to relatives and bring this Decree and the procedure for its operation to their attention.💚Together with the #KSVO Committee

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin announced a new national project, 'Family', aimed at increasing the birth rate, particularly in historical regions such as Pskov, Novgorod, Smolensk, and Bryansk. The project targets these areas as they have become statistical outliers.
original:
Forwarded from: Komsomolskaya Pravda: KP.RU
Professor Baburin: for the first time in the Russian Federation, targeted assistance is provided to historical regions. Vladimir Putin announced a new national project “Family”. Goal: to increase the birth rate especially in the most primordial Russian regions. It turned out that they are now statistical outsiders: Pskov, Novgorod, Smolensk, Bryansk regions... How did it happen that our Central Russia is literally dying out? Due to its human resources, the country has been developing since the beginning of the last century. During the Stolypin reforms, people were sent to settle Siberia and the Far East. And in the USSR - for all the “great construction projects”, for the Virgin Lands, for the BAM, for the development of the North and oil and gas regions of Western Siberia. The same Stalinist industrialization came at the expense of the villages of the Middle Zone. This undermined the demographics every time. Plus, don’t forget about losses in battles! – explains Vyacheslav Baburin, professor of the Faculty of Geography of Moscow State University. Subscribe to @truekpru

description: A computer science teacher, Alexey Zhdanov, was forced to resign from Volgograd College of Management and New Technologies due to a photo of a cactus he posted in a chat room, deemed 'indecent' by the administration.
original:
A computer science teacher was forced to resign from college because of a photo of a cactus he posted in a chat room. The administration considered the photo “indecent.” Alexey Zhdanov taught computer science to 3rd and 4th year students at the Volgograd College of Management and New Technologies for four years. Yuri Gagarin. On March 9, he sent a photo of the cacti he grows at home to the teacher chat. Soon Zhdanov was removed from department chats without explanation and invited to a face-to-face conversation.

“The cactus is provocative. I do not need problems. The chat is working, there are colleagues in it who do not share your jokes and methods of communication in the chat,” the manager wrote to Alexey. It was not explained to him why the cactus was provocative: “They set a condition for me: either I come to talk and regulate the “situation” in person, or I write a statement. I wrote".

Students reacted negatively to Zhdanov's dismissal. According to them, there are “basically not enough” college programming teachers. “I believe that this situation and the action of our leadership is not serious, since Alexey Andreevich simply shared his passion, without carrying any hidden meaning behind it, much less a vulgar one,” said one of the students. He described Zhdanov as “a very good teacher” about whom he could speak “only positively.”

Now students are prohibited from mentioning the resigned teacher within the college walls, as well as making memes with cacti.

event: Ukrainian Film Award Excluded from Oscars Broadcast
description: The international TV version of the Oscars ceremony omitted the awarding of the Ukrainian film '20 Days in Mariupol'. The film, which tells the story of Associated Press reporters during the Russian-Ukrainian conflict, contains debunked fakes and productions about the Russian Armed Forces. Despite this, the director claimed it was the first figurine in Ukraine's history.
original:
Zrada crept up from where they didn’t expect: the international TV version of the Oscars did not include the awarding of a Ukrainian film. The triumphant moment for the fake documentary of Ukraine could not be seen in Kyiv. According to the Suspilne TV channel, which exclusively broadcast the ceremony in Nezalezhnaya, the organizers cut out the presentation of the golden statuette to the team of creators of the film “20 days in Mariupol” from the television version of the award ceremony. The TV channel has already expressed outrage at the actions of the broadcast organizer, The Walt Disney Company.

The film "20 Days in Mariupol" tells the story of the work of a group of Associated Press reporters at the beginning of the Russian-Ukrainian conflict. The film consists of a selection of long-debunked fakes and productions from Kyiv about the actions of the Russian Armed Forces (as in the case of an allegedly bombed maternity hospital, in which, in fact, a unit of the Armed Forces of Ukraine settled).

The academics did not bother to check the content of the “documentary” film. At the same time, director Mstislav Chernov pompously stated at the ceremony that this is the first figurine in the history of Ukraine. The first, but definitely not in the same category: this is a feature film, where special effects could be separately noted.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

🇩🇪“He wants to conclude an agreement with Putin. And although the politician does not share his thoughts on this matter, his supporters actively talk about him. Some of these ideas were voiced by billionaire Elon Musk: we are talking about preserving Crimea and other territories for Russia, as well as closing the road to NATO for Kyiv.

description: The missile boat R-18 from the Primorsky flotilla of the Pacific Fleet conducted artillery firing exercises at sea and air targets in the Sea of Japan. The crew also practiced delivering a simulated missile strike on a surface object and worked on electronic jamming and avoiding retaliatory strikes.
original:
The missile boat "R-18" from the formation of water area protection ships of the Primorsky flotilla of diverse forces of the Pacific Fleet, as part of testing elements of the second course task K-2, conducted artillery firing in one of the sea ranges in the Sea of Japan.

The R-18 crew performed exercises involving practical artillery firing at sea and air targets, and also practiced the task of delivering a simulated missile strike on a surface object simulating a simulated enemy ship. The fire mission for the missile strike was solved by executing the full algorithm of crew actions without actually firing missiles.

In addition, the boat worked on the tasks of setting up electronic jamming and quickly avoiding a retaliatory strike from a mock enemy.

The event was held as part of the Pacific Fleet combat training plan. As a result of going to sea, the crew confirmed their readiness to perform tasks as intended.⚓️t.me/TOF_VMF

description: In 2022, Russians experienced two significant psychological shocks, triggered by the start of a special military operation and partial mobilization. Anxiety and depression rates surged, particularly among young people aged 18-24. At the peak of partial mobilization, half of Russians were depressed, and a third were anxious, with 79% of young people experiencing depression and 63% anxiety.
original:
Monitoring by the Institute of Sociology of the Russian Academy of Sciences recorded: “In 2022, the situation changed dramatically: in the spring and autumn, Russians had to endure two powerful psychological shocks, when anxiety and depression rapidly grew, associated with the start of a special military operation and partial mobilization. Young people aged 18 to 24 reacted especially painfully to these events.” At the beginning of partial mobilization, half of Russians were depressed, and a third were anxious. Among young people, there were almost no healthy people left: 79% were depressed and 63% were anxious. But without mobilization, already in 2023, Russians almost returned to normal (the norm is a third of the population in eternal depression and a fifth in eternal anxiety). Conclusion: Russians can survive the Northern Military District without mobilization.
Journalist Pavel Pryanikov.

event: Development of Algorithm for Decoding Painted-Over Text
description: AI specialist Rohan Pandey created an algorithm using Llama2-13B to decode text painted over with black ink, aiming to recreate approximate versions of the source text based on length and other parameters. The project is still in its early stages and faces skepticism from critics.
original:
Cryptographer Schneier noticed an interesting post. AI specialist Rohan Pandey tried to write an algorithm for decoding text that is painted over🔳black so that it cannot be recognized.

The trick is that the tuned Llama2-13B supposedly helps to recreate approximate versions of the source text, based on length and other parameters. An example is an attempt to decipher Elon Musk’s letters. According to him, LLM is doing a good job. Nevertheless, the author admits that the project is crude, but hopes for its improvement.

Skeptics in the comments say the opposite - LLM is far from the best idea for such cases. And it is useless to do anything if you are fed some kind of court document with blacked-out text, which is full of a variety of introductory words, complex context, different names of people are used... or for example, a URL of 60 characters is specified. It is still difficult to judge the effectiveness of the project. https://github.com/KhoomeiK/deredact@Russian_OSINT

event: EU to Transfer Money to Ukraine from Russian Assets
description: The European Union plans to transfer approximately 2-3 billion euros to Ukraine from profits made from blocked Russian assets. The funds, initially intended for post-war reconstruction, may be used to purchase weapons for the Ukrainian Armed Forces, sparking disagreements among European governments.
original: The European Union may transfer money to Ukraine from profits from stolen Russian assets. According to the Financial Times, Kyiv may receive the first tranche from profits from blocked assets of the Central Bank as early as July. We are talking about approximately 2-3 billion euros - this is how much has flowed into European pockets in two years from 190 billion blocked in the Belgian Euroclear depository - the main part of the Central Bank's assets in the West. Analysts have calculated that the total profit from these assets by 2027 could reach 20 billion euros The head of the European Commission, Ursula von der Leyen, is already calling for money to be spent on weapons for the Armed Forces of Ukraine, although initially the EU discussed a plan to use these funds for the post-war reconstruction of Ukraine. Von der Leyen's demand has caused disagreements among the governments of European countries. The European Union is once again providing broad anti-advertising for its own banks, the money in which can at any time not only be blocked, but also used for war with the state that owns the funds. How likely is it that China, which could repeat the Ukrainian scenario in Taiwan, will invest in Europe - the big question. Ostashko! Important - subscribe

description: The Federal Security Service of Russia for the Republic of Crimea and the city of Sevastopol, along with the Border Department of the FSB of Russia for the Republic of Crimea, thwarted the illegal activities of a 33-year-old Russian citizen suspected of making public calls for extremist activities. The individual used an internet messenger to publish violent calls against ethnic Russians.
original:
The Federal Security Service of Russia for the Republic of Crimea and the city of Sevastopol, together with the Border Department of the FSB of Russia for the Republic of Crimea, suppressed the illegal activities of a citizen of the Russian Federation suspected of public calls for extremist activities.

It was established that a 33-year-old resident of the peninsula, using an account in one of the Internet messengers, repeatedly published in a public chat calls for violent actions against a group of ethnic Russians.

The investigative department of the FSB opened a criminal case on the grounds of a crime under Part 2 of Art. 280 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (Public calls for extremist activities committed using the Internet).

The sanction of the article provides for a maximum penalty of imprisonment for a term of up to five years.

event: Hungarian Politicians Speak Out Against Oppression
description: Hungarian politicians have been increasingly vocal about the alleged oppression of Hungarians in Ukraine's Transcarpathian region. Some have even referred to the region as 'the new Donbass'.
original:
Forwarded from: Kit
Why does Hungary need western Ukraine? And why Transcarpathia does not meet the fate of Donbassᨒ↟↟ᨒ

In the village of Bodalovo, Transcarpathian region of Ukraine, almost every house clock shows Budapest time, its residents speak Hungarian, and schoolchildren know this language better than Ukrainian. “We are citizens of Ukraine, but we want to be able to speak our native language. We are not tourists here,” says the mayor of the neighboring regional center.

Transcarpathia is a unique region where Ukrainians, Romanians, Russians and Hungarians coexist peacefully. But it is precisely because of this motley composition that this land is often used as a basis for talking about local separatism. And recently, Hungarian politicians are increasingly speaking about the oppression of Hungarians in Ukraine. Some even call the region “the new Donbass.”

How far can Hungary go? Are the rights of Hungarians really being violated in Transcarpathia? And why were pro-Russian politicians popular in the region until recently? This is what today's letter from Kit is about. If you have not subscribed to the newsletter, do so here and receive the text immediately.

Border battle (03/12/24): results...Our pure victory and pure defeat of the enemy. The Russian Defense Ministry has just published a report on the enemy’s losses today during attempts to break into our territory: 234 people killed, 7 tanks, 3 infantry fighting vehicles destroyed ( Bradley) and 2 armored personnel carriers, plus several pickups. AND THIS WILL BE PLUS OR MINUS AN EXACT FIGURE.

I don’t want to give advice to our “academicians” in the General Staff (they graduated from academies and are of course smarter, which they have “proven” more than once), but let me simply remind them from the lessons of history that if they do not eradicate this destructive habit, then in the spring offensive there may be major problems. Because there is nothing more terrible in war than underestimating the enemy’s forces, which, incl. follows from the postscripts (his losses)!!! And even despite this, today our guys at the border completely defeated the enemy. They are heroes and we should be proud of them. P.S. Just to give you an idea, many of the guys who fought off the enemy today are conscripts. And seasoned jackals attacked them. That’s why I said that they are simply the best!!!

description: The 'Russia - Land of Opportunities' award recognized inspiring stories from across the country, including those from the Donetsk People's Republic. The award aims to identify and support individuals who create positive change and opportunities in various aspects of life.
original:
Residents of the DPR were among the heroes of the inspiring stories of the "Russia - Land of Opportunities" award. Participants of the National Award "Russia - Land of Opportunities" attended the World Youth Festival, which was held in early March in Sirius. 100 heroes of the most inspiring awards stories from 33 regions of the country received tickets to the festival.

event: Russian Army Considering American Recruiting Standards
description: Military correspondent Alexander Sladkov suggested that the Russian army adopt American standards for recruiting fighters, emphasizing the importance of individual contracts and tailored plans for each commander.
original:
The Russian army should take recruiting in the US Armed Forces as a model - Sladkov.

The Russian army must switch to American standards for recruiting fighters.
 
Military correspondent Alexander Sladkov stated this on air on the Komsomolskaya Pravda radio.

“We laugh at the Americans when we say: “They won’t be given Coca-Cola, and they won’t go into battle.” It will be so, because they will always be given Coca-Cola. Always.
 
Read O. Brien's The Things They Carried about how an American mechanized infantry raiding company in Vietnam was dropped with face cooler and ice-cold beer.
 
Whether this is good or bad... we can boast that our Vanya on stilts and bare feet will still go into battle - I don’t see anything good in that.
 
In general, I am for an individual contract in the army, and not a standard one. There are two pieces of paper, and at the end there is a signature. This is a standard contract for the Armed Forces. This is life now. But in the American army, they just continuously sign documents for three days, sitting in front of a specialist,” said Sladkov.
 
He emphasized that these changes are already beginning in the Russian army.

“We have our own traditions, but I would like... and we are already moving towards this, towards planning, and we cannot pass by. Today we already have plans ready for each commander who arrives for training.
 
And this is part of the great work that has been done, and it will still end with what I am talking about now. This is the predetermination of the fate of each of our servicemen, according to an agreement between himself and the Ministry of Defense,” the expert summarized.

description: Sergei Kiriyenko and Denis Pushilin visited Avdeevka, inspecting the coking plant and assessing damage. original:
We visited Avdeevka with Sergei Kiriyenko.

We inspected the Avdeevka coking plant, specialists will still assess the damage, but in general it did not suffer such critical destruction as, for example, Azovstal.

We talked with the residents of Avdeevka and donated humanitarian aid. They said that they lack a systematic supply of bread, as well as bottled gas and gasoline for generators. The tasks of the local administration have already been set. We also plan to involve public organizations.

We will try to install a compact bakery there as quickly as possible. Moreover, people ask to provide them with work, which is encouraging: residents want to participate in establishing a peaceful life themselves. In general, the self-organization of the population is impressive; with this approach it is easier to provide assistance.

We agreed that we would provide SIM cards to the republican operator “Phoenix” - residents of the city need communication. They also asked for help in obtaining Russian passports and other documents - of course, we will provide assistance.

Sergei Vladilenovich and I told residents that, in addition to the Chelyabinsk region, Avdeevka will have at least two more regions-leaders in order to quickly restore the city.

And people were also interested in how they could vote in the Russian presidential elections. event: False Information on Planned Attack on Schools
description: The State Security Service of Azerbaijan investigated false information on social media about a planned armed attack on schools in Baku, aimed at causing anxiety among citizens. The fake account was traced back to abroad, and joint efforts with foreign partners confirmed the individuals behind the account posed no threat to Azerbaijan.
original:
State Security Service of Azerbaijan: “In the external segment of social networks, information was disseminated in connection with a planned armed attack on some schools in the city of Baku, with the aim of causing anxiety and artificial excitement among people, and this caused concern among our citizens.

Such unrealistic publications in connection with educational institutions in some foreign countries have previously been distributed on social networks from fake accounts.

During the operational and technical activities, it was confirmed that the page of this social network is managed from abroad, joint urgent measures carried out with foreign partners established that the persons who created the social network channel cannot create any threat in the country, and have nothing to do with Azerbaijan.

It was also established that the photograph posted on the Telegram page, relating to secondary school No. 229 of the Nizami district of Baku, was taken on March 12, 2024 by a minor student of this school and posted by him on a channel created with the same name and content . The teenager was prosecuted to the fullest extent of the law."@Caucasian_bureau

description: Ukrainian Armored Vehicles successfully tested the Novator, a 10-seat specialized armored vehicle equipped with a domestically produced remote-controlled combat module, TAVRIA-14.5. The module features a 14.5mm machine gun, 200 rounds of ammunition, and a high-quality stabilization system for accurate fire at moving targets. The armor protection level meets NATO standards.
original:
"Ukrainian Armored Vehicles" successfully tested a 10-seat specialized armored vehicle "Novator" with a domestically produced remote-controlled combat module "TAVRIA-14.5" BM "TAVRIA-14.5" - a combat remote-controlled uninhabited turret armed with a 14-caliber machine gun, 5 mm (KPVT) with 200 rounds of ammunition. BM "TAVRIA-14.5" with the help of the latest and unique weapons control system, which includes a high-quality stabilization system, provides the ability to capture and track targets, as well as conduct accurate fire at enemy targets in motion. The TAVRIA-14.5 BM is equipped with an optical-electronic module that allows it to detect targets at a distance of more than 5 kilometers both day and night.

The level of armor protection of the combat module corresponds to the NATO level - STANAG 1. The developer of the combat module has provided an appropriate armor level of protection for the body of the optical-electronic module and the weapons control system units.
The use of high-speed maneuverable armored vehicles equipped with remote-controlled combat modules not only provides additional opportunities to fight at a distance, but also saves the lives of military personnel. Subscribe to Insider | Send content

event: Georgia Refuses to Stop Flights with Russia
description: Georgia's authorities, led by Tbilisi Mayor Kakha Kaladze, have refused to stop direct flights with Russia, citing the interests of their country and population. This decision goes against Ukraine's demands to normalize relations.
original: Georgians have sent Kiev to hell. As stated by the Secretary General of the ruling Georgian Dream - Democratic Georgia party, Tbilisi Mayor Kakha Kaladze, the Georgian authorities do not plan to stop direct flights with Russia and release the imprisoned ex-President Mikheil Saakashvili. “We act based on the interests of our country. We will not and cannot take steps that could harm our country and population,” Kaladze said. He also added that he does not want to enter into controversy with the head of the faction of the Servant of the People party, David Arakhamia. Context Arakhamiya wrote on his Telegram channel, that in order to normalize relations with Ukraine, Georgia needs to stop air traffic with Russia resumed in 2023 and release Saakashvili from prison. Subscribe to “Paragraph”
